title: The Stretch Reflex
description: A 60-second lesson on The Stretch Reflex.

hook.text: A doctor taps your knee and your leg kicks. That's the stretch reflex ‚Äî and it limits your flexibility.

buildup.text: Muscle spindles detect rapid stretching. They fire a signal that contracts the muscle to prevent tearing.

discovery.text: This reflex protects you from injury. But it also fights you every time you try to stretch further.

twist.text: Slow, sustained stretches bypass it. The spindles calm down after about 20‚Äì30 seconds.

climax.text: That's why holding a stretch works ‚Äî you're waiting for the reflex to switch off.

punchline.text: Your muscles fight stretching to protect you. Patience wins.
